The headline ''Newscasters Leave Black Rock, the House Edward R. Murrow Built'' (news article, Oct. 21) seems to echo the common characterization of Yankee Stadium as ''the house that Ruth built.''

In fact, Murrow's primary radio venue had been Studio Nine in the old, old CBS building at 485 Madison Avenue. No one will question Murrow's importance in building the strong CBS News operation that persisted for some three decades. In contrast to Murrow's experience, however, Babe Ruth played at the stadium for many years and at the close of his career was honored, not rejected.
